intro: Wissadula scabra, commonly known as the rough wissadula, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Wissadula scabra is often found growing on rocky outcrops and in sandy soils, making it a resilient and hardy species.
